text: hey everybody thomas joseph here with
another kitchen conundrum that i know
we've all had squeezing out your
favorite greens using one of these
flower sack towels and the towel it gets
stained up right and it takes a lot of
effort to do all of this well i'm going
to show you a really new and interesting
way to squeeze out your greens that
won't stain your towels and it's
actually a lot of fun to do so i'm gonna
abandon ship here and i'm gonna show you
this cool technique i have a steamer
basket set over a couple inches of
simmering water i'm using kale today but
you can use any green that you like
whether it's spinach Swiss chard any
leafy greens would work well with this
technique and I have three bunches of
kale here which is about a pound and a
half of kale into the steamer basket I'm
gonna steam this for about five minutes
adding more as it builds down and now
for the trick using a ricer instead of a
towel makes quick work of squeezing out
all of the moisture from the kale pack
your kale right into the ricer and then
all you have to do kind of like one of
those citrus presses is just squeeze it
out and you get so much of the liquid
out with minimal effort and repeat the
process a few times until all of the
kale is done so one of my all-time
favorite side dishes for Thanksgiving is
creamed spinach so I'm giving it a try
today with the kale that we just made I
have a couple of shallots that are
finely mince sauteing in a few
tablespoons of butter I'm going to add
two tablespoons of all-purpose flour and
this is basically creating a roux for
our wonderful bechamel sauce and a
bechamel is simply a thickened milk
sauce so I'm just going to let the flour
cook out the taste of the flour and then
I'm going to slowly add two cups of
whole milk now this mixture has to come
up to a boil in order for the flour to
reach its thickening potential so the
bechamel is nice and thick it's reduced
slightly for about five minutes
I'm going to season it up with some
freshly grated nutmeg which really adds
some great flavor a little bit of salt
and some freshly ground black pepper and
you can be liberal here with your
seasoning because you're going to add
all of these greens into your bechamel
and that's really what's going to flavor
your dish here I'm going to add in our
steamed and squeezed kale that's almost
bone-dry here and it's going to absorb
all of that delicious bechamel sauce so
just gently stir this together warming
the Greens mixing everything together
this smells so delicious
and there you have it an easier faster
and better way to squeeze out your
greens for your favorite side dish
